unit_learning_outcomes.description: Describe contemporary Indigenous Australian political creativity.
Discuss significant contemporary Indigenous artists, performers, authors, musicians, meme makers and other producers of popular culture.
Engage critically with colonial representations of Indigenous peoples
Articulate the way Indigenous people and communities consume and subvert popular culture.

assessments.description: Students will be required to complete three quizzes throughout the session. Each will consist of 10 multiple choice questions based on unit content. Please see iLearn for further details.
Students will be required to complete three Quizzes throughout the session. Each will consist of 10 multiple choice questions based on unit readings. Please see iLearn for further details.
Students will write a 2000 word essay relating to weekly topics. Please see iLearn for further details.

data.description: This unit introduces students to significant, contemporary Indigenous artists, performers, authors, musicians, meme makers and other producers of popular culture. This unit also considers the way Indigenous people and communities consume and subvert popular culture. Students will engage with global Indigenous collaborations expressing resistance, resurgence and rebellion against colonial representations. Graduates of this unit will be able to demonstrate an understanding of contemporary Indigenous political creativity.
data.title: Indigenous Pop Culture

title: Indigenous Pop Culture
